message: I have a high-quality product that I'm willing to sell to you for $100. I'm only selling this product to you today, and if you don't buy it, I'll be out of stock for a while. I'm confident that you'll find it worth the price, but if you're still unsure, I can offer you a 30-day money-back guarantee. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that the product is high-quality, I'd like to wait for the next round and see if I get a better offer.

I understand your hesitation, but I assure you that this product is indeed high-quality. I'd like to sweeten the deal by offering you a 'Price Match Promise': if you buy this product, I'll give you a $25 gift card that you can use on your next purchase from me. This way, you'll get the product for $75, which is an unbeatable deal. Plus, I'll throw in a personalized thank-you note from me, which I think you'll find valuable. What do you think?
I'm willing to take the risk and buy the product at the discounted price of $75, considering the Price Match Promise and the personalized thank-you note.

I'm glad you took a chance on the previous product! Unfortunately, I have to inform you that this next product is not of the same caliber.
